Package projects.spatial.knnutils

Class BoundedPriorityQueue<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • projects.spatial.knnutils.BoundedPriorityQueue<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<T>, PriorityQueue<T>
    public class BoundedPriorityQueue<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements PriorityQueue<T>

    BoundedPriorityQueue is a priority queue whose number of elements is bounded. Insertions are such that if the queue's provided capacity is surpassed, its length is not expanded, but rather the maximum priority element is ejected (which could be the element just attempted to be enqueued).

    YOU ***** MUST ***** IMPLEMENT THIS CLASS!

    Author:
    Jason Filippou
    See Also:
    PriorityQueue, PriorityQueueNode

    • Method Detail

      • enqueue

        public void enqueue​(T element,
                    java.math.BigDecimal priority)

        Enqueueing elements for BoundedPriorityQueues works a little bit differently from general case PriorityQueues. If the queue is not at capacity, the element is inserted at its appropriate location in the sequence. On the other hand, if the object is at capacity, the element is inserted in its appropriate spot in the sequence (if such a spot exists, based on its priority) and the maximum priority element is ejected from the structure.

        Specified by:
        enqueue in interface PriorityQueue<T>
        Parameters:
        element - The element to insert in the queue.
        priority - The priority of the element to insert in the queue.
        See Also:
        KDPoint.distanceSquared(KDPoint), BigDecimal

      • last

        public T last()
        Returns the last element in the queue. Useful for cases where we want to compare the priorities of a given quantity with the maximum priority of our stored quantities. In a minheap-based implementation of any PriorityQueue, this operation would scan O(n) nodes and O(nlogn) links. In an array-based implementation, it takes constant time.
        Returns:
        The maximum priority element in our queue, or null if the queue is empty.

        Returns:
        true iff element is in this, false otherwise.
